rComments: I had her for 116 and currently 117 and she is still wonderful. I've heard negative feedback about her from people, but I really don't know why. She is easy going,  genuinely cares about her students, and wants her students to be successful. She tells us about internship opportunities and passes our resumes on to her contacts in industry.

I'm not sure what this class is. Most people currently taking it are Jr or Sr level and yet we are treated as if the most basic concepts are mind-bogglingly complex. Linda is far too excited about the dull intricacies of the topics she presents. Including but not limited to: 1970s VHS, Incorrect terminology, buzzwords, optional(required) text book.

Linda isn't really my cup of tea. A lot of time is spent learning CS buzzwords and doing pointless activities - it feels a lot like a high school class sometimes. That said, I can see where people would like her. Very friendly and is super available to answer questions. Okay teacher, and no doubt a useful class, but could be seriously streamlined.
Linda is disorganized and she wastes the entire class time. So much busy work. Didn't learn anything from her lectures and would not take a class from her again.

Very helpful and wonderful person. She's always available after class and before class to help students. There was a lot of reading and homework, but she gives a lot of time to do it. Very reasonable grader and makes every class enjoyable.

Linda is unorganized and her class is like a high school class. pop quizzes, raising your hand for participation in a class with 0 interest from anybody. She made the class so much harder and had so much unncessary material. She seems spacey and just not on it. If I had known how she was before, I probably would not have taken the class.

Overall Linda is pretty awesome. I have heard some pretty negative feedback about her, but she turned out to be really great. Her class overall was not as interesting as I initially thought it would be. But Linda is really nice, easy going, and extremely helpful in making students successful. The one downer is the horrid text book we have to read.

The class is not about programming skills at all. The quizzes and final are all about just being able to memorize the stupid papers she makes people read in the class.  However, the class is not difficult at all. It's just quite possibly one of the most borings classes I've ever taken. Linda definitely did not make this experience less painful.
